name: Just Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a place! After a long day's drive from Healdsburg - big mistake to do that much driving in one day, we finally got into Paso Robles, only to discover that the Inn is another 15 winding miles away. A beautiful drive out to the Inn, despite our weariness. Perfect for a convertible.
reviews.title: Amazing Place

likes.disliked: — long drive out to the Inn from town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know about the reviews from 4 years ago, but our experience with both the hotel and Deborah's Room, the restaurant, were phenomenal. When we arrived, we checked into the Tuscany room, which is upstairs and has the best view of the vineyards. There was a chilled bottle of Justin chardonnay waiting for us. During dinner, the waiter was very helpful, and repeatedly offered to pour tastes of other wines to compare with what we had ordered. There are only 4 tables in the restaurant, so it is quiet and peaceful.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return to Just Inn
Just Inn has gone down hill
reviews.text: The included breakfast the next morning was in an outdoor covered area. The multi-course breakfast was delicious.

reviews.title: Slowly Going Down Hill
reviews.text: Everytrhing about Just Inn - the room, food, wine, views - was high quality, making it easy to relax and enjoy your time there

reviews.title: Opulent French chatelau in South Central Coast Region
reviews.text: We just returned from a long weekend stay in the Tuscany Suite at the Just Inn Bed & Breakfast. This is our first time staying in the Paso Robles area and we rate this as one in our top ten. The service is excellent and the grounds beautiful. We found our room, the Tuscany suite immaculate and the decor romantic . Everything about the room is excellent and I am very picky, one can easily call me a hotel snob.

description: The JUST Inn invites rest and relaxation in sumptuous style. Each of our four luxury suites: Tuscany, Provence, Sussex, and Bordeaux, are appointed in fine European tradition. Tapestry-covered furnishings, queen and king sized feather beds and frescoed ceilings add to the charm and comfort of these private suites. A visit to the Inn is complete with a stroll in the English Gardens or a dip in the heated spa and seasonal pool.
